clinical_study.brief_title: Mechanisms of Human Cutaneous Microcirculation in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Etude de la Reserve Vasomotrice Microcirculatoire cutanée

brief_summary.textblock: Microvascular dysfunctions are critical events in several diseases including diabetes. This study will develop a methodology for microvascular investigation in human skin. The purpose of the study is to investigate the physiological response of the cutaneous microcirculation to physical, thermal, mechanical or chemical stimulations.

detailed_description.textblock: This study has investigated various aspects of the physiology of the microcirculation in the past years and is still recruiting under parallel protocols of physiological investigations of the neurovascular control of the cutaneous microcirculation.

primary_outcome.measure: Amplitude of the vasomotor response to stimuli

secondary_outcome.measure: Kinetics of the vasomotor response to stimuli

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers with no clinical signs of, or risk factors for, vascular disease
Exclusion Criteria:
- Smokers, Pregnancy, Allergy,
